entry.title: Computational complexity in algebraic regression
entry.summary: We analyze the complexity of fitting a variety, coming from a class of varieties, to a configuration of points in $\Bbb C^n$. The complexity measure, called the algebraic complexity, computes the Euclidean Distance Degree (EDdegree) of a certain variety called the hypothesis variety as the number of points in the configuration increases. For the problem of fitting an $(n-1)$-sphere to a configuration of $m$ points in $\Bbb C^n$, we give a closed formula of the algebraic complexity of the hypothesis variety as $m$ grows for the case of $n=1$. For the case $n>1$ we conjecture a generalization of this formula supported by numerical experiments.
